Legal_Issue: Whether the trademark 'MacGregor' was sufficiently used in Canada to avoid expungement
Evidence_Assessment: Affidavits and evidence of continuous use since 1975 for smoked kippered herring only
Decision_Outcome: Trademark upheld for smoked kippered herring; expunged for other listed wares
Burden_of_Proof: On applicant to show non-use, but on registrant to demonstrate use
Credibility_Factor: Evidence of export with packaging marked in Canada considered credible
Legal_Rule: Under s. 4(3) of the Trade-marks Act, a trademark is deemed used if marked on wares or packaging and exported from Canada
Procedural_Issue: Federal Court reviewing Registrar’s decision on expungement application
Grounds_for_Claim: Non-use of the trademark for listed goods over three years
Outcome_on_Merits: Partial success: claim allowed in part, denied in part
Key_Evidence_Considered: Packaging marked with 'MacGregor' in Canada prior to export; affidavits showing continuous use since 1975
Applicant_Challenge: Scott & Aylen applied to expunge due to alleged non-use
Court_Result: Trademark retained for smoked kippered herring, expunged for other goods
Defendant_Response: National Sea Products Ltd. provided evidence of use in export activities
Remedy_Requested: Expungement of trademark for non-used goods
Remedy_Sought: Removal of trademark registration for goods not in use
Authority: Registrar of Trademarks, subject to Federal Court review
Claimant_Status: Applicant (Scott & Aylen) as challenger of registration
Grounds_for_Inadmissibility_or_Allegatio: Non-use of trademark for specified goods for more than three years
Outcome_of_Review: Registrar’s decision varied: trademark maintained for one product, removed for others
Governing_Rule: s. 4(3), Trade-marks Act – deemed use through export
